<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: LinearLayout parentLayout = (LinearLayout) findViewById(R.id.parent_layout);
ListView xList = (ListView) findViewById(R.id.xlist);
ListView yList = (ListView) findViewById(R.id.ylist);

if (condition) {
    parentLayout.removeView(xList);
    parentLayout.addView(xList);
} else {
    parentLayout.removeView(yList);
    parentLayout.addView(yList);
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the removeView() and addView() methods of the parent layout to switch the ordering of the views. First, you need to get references to the parent layout and the two list views using findViewById(). Then, based on the condition, you can remove the desired list view from the parent layout using removeView() and add it back in the desired position using addView().
